content: clearly visible at the top - ref figs 3 & 4 pumpkin lantern page 4 pumpkin lantern page 5 pumpkin - knitted flat beginning at the bottom of the pumpkin with yarn a cast on 10 sts row 1 increase kfb p1 five times 15sts row 2 increase kfb p2 five times 20sts row 3 increase k3 pfb five times 25sts row 4 k2 p3 five times row 5 k3 p2 five times row 6-9 repeat last 2 row twice row 10 k2 p3 five times row 11 decrease k3 p2tog five times 20sts row 12 decrease k1 p2tog p1 five times 15sts cut yarn thread end through all 15 pumpkin top sts as you slip the stitches off the knitting needles join back seam use the tail end from the cast-on edge to work a running stitch all along the cast-on edge and then pull up to gather the edge for the pumpkin base work mattress stitch to join the back seam add a tiny blob of glue to the bottom of the balloon light then insert the balloon light into the pumpkin adhering the centre of the pumpkin base onto the bottom of the light and making sure the stalk part of the stopper is clearly visible at the top - ref figs 3 & 4 check the glue is dry before completing the pumpkin as before remember to get in touch if you need a little extra advice and of course there is more much more to learn create and be inspired by here @dotpebbles_knits please also remember that this pattern like all of my patterns is copyrighted this prohibits copying or reproducing any of its writing content for your own profit however if you want to sell what you ve made from any of my patterns then that is perfectly fine - i actually encourage it and have an instagram account @imadethisrabbit_shop to promote you reach out with #imadethisrabbit_shop and please do share what you ve created from this pattern #dotpebbles_knits #dotpebblescreatureland #imadethisacorn lantern discover more patterns here @dotpebbles_knits x
